message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.IR 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with speech act recognition in asynchronous conversations. The use of neural architecture based on hierarchical LSTMs and conditional random fields (CRF) for SAR suggests that it may also belong to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). The use of semi-supervised learning and adversarial training to improve the results further suggests that it may also belong to cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval).
